fields.address: Sultan Ahmet, Atmeydanı Cd. No:7, 34122 Fatih/İstanbul, Turkey
fields.description: Sultan Ahmed Mosque, also known as the Blue Mosque, is a historic mosque located in Istanbul, Turkey.
fields.hours: Closes for prayers 5 times a day; open all other times.

fields.address: Sultan Ahmet, Ayasofya Meydanı No:1, 34122 Fatih/İstanbul, Turkey
fields.description: The Hagia Sophia, which was the largest building in the world when it was built, is considered the epitome of Byzantine architecture.
fields.hours: 9:00 to 7:00 during the summer, 9:00 to 6:00 during the winter.

fields.description: The Brandenburg Gate was often a site for major historical events and is today considered a symbol of the tumultuous history of Germany.
The notorious island of Alcatraz served as a prison for many high profile prisoners for years.
fields.hours: Boats depart for Alcatraz every half an hour starting at 8:30 and running until 4:00.

fields.description: Berlin’s Museumsinsel is home to the legendary bust of Nefertiti and the Pergamon Altar – and five museums with works from Ancient Egypt, Byzantium and Berlin.
Come to General Assembly, and marvel at a truly astounding collection of nerds.
fields.hours: Weekdays 9-5 and whenever you have the time to focus.

fields.description: The Acropolis of Athens is an ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens and contains the remains of several ancient buildings of great architectural and historic significance, the most famous being the Parthenon.
fields.hours: The Acropolis can always be viewed.

fields.address: Piazza San Marco, 30100 Venezia VE, Italy
fields.description: Piazza San Marco often known in English as St Mark's Square, is the principal public square of Venice, Italy.
fields.hours: The Piazza is always open unless there are cases of flooding.
